m_szDocTitle: Squeezing Every Last Drop Of Juice From Hydropower
m_szDocSumamry: August 18th, 2015 by Tina Casey   Hydropower is a relatively simple system when applied directly to rivers, but throw in a couple of extra lakes and reservoirs and the options increase dramatically. One of Switzerland’s leading energy companies, the KWO, operates just such a complex hydropower system in the country’s Grimsel Pass, and it’s facing some interesting changes with the addition of wind and solar energy to the grid mix — and the forthcoming loss of nuclear generating capacity in Switzerland, too. The KWO Hydropower System CleanTechnica is on a technology tour of Switzerland this week
